channel.title: Drive on Wonderful World
channel.description: Recent content in Drive on Wonderful World

item.title: Natchez Trace Parkway
item.description: The Natchez Trace Parkway is a 444-mile recreational road and scenic drive through three states. It roughly follows the “Old Natchez Trace” a historic travel corridor used by American Indians, “Kaintucks,” European settlers, slave traders, soldiers, and future presidents. Today, people can enjoy not only a scenic drive but also hiking, biking, horseback riding, and camping along the parkway. The Sunken Trace is one of the most photographed sites along the Parkway.
